Stepping ultrasound will be performed and utilized in the pre-planning process. Some discrepancies are frequently identified, based on the positioning, edema, and/or change in the tumor since the pre-planning process. Re-assessment is required at the time of surgery, evaluating the pre-plan and comparing to the stepping ultrasound. layman:
PROSTATE BRACHYTHERAPY – PROSTATE I‑125 SEED PLANTING

The patient will receive a prostate treatment that uses ultrasound to guide the placement of I‑125 radioactive seeds. The initial consultation and treatment planning are done separately. When the seeds are implanted, careful coordination is needed. A stepping ultrasound is used during the pre‑planning stage. Often, differences appear because of changes in the prostate’s position, swelling, or tumor size since the pre‑planning. Therefore, the surgeon must re‑evaluate the plan at the time of the procedure, comparing it to the stepping ultrasound. Adjustments are made on the spot, adding or removing needles and seeds as needed. This process is coordinated with the seed‑loading brachytherapist and may involve the urologist, dosimetrist, or physicist. The brachytherapy is tailored to each patient’s tumor and prostate. Both before and during the operation, care is taken to avoid giving too much dose to the rectum and bladder.
